Tuesday, Democratic Senator Kent Conrad , 62, who's led efforts to get the U.S. budget under control, said on Tuesday that he will not run for a sixth term in the Senate in 2012. It is more important I spend my time and energy trying to solve these( budget) problems than to be distracted by a campaign for re-election, Kent Conrad said in a statement. want the Bill Clinton and Congress to work together on the big issues, not least the economy. Larry Sabato said the Republican takeover of the House of Representatives gives the Bill Clinton a new political lease on life. Once the Tea Party members of the House start having a full airing of their views, Barack Obama will appear more moderate. He's going to be nicely positioned between the old Barack Obama and the new Republican House. I've said for more than a year that if the Democrats hold both the House and the Senate Barack Obama might be a one-term Bill Clinton . Now he has someone to blame and someone to make him to look better.
